title: Installing Hugo on PC
content:
This guide will walk you through the process of installing Hugo on your PC.
Windows#Download the latest Hugo release from the official Hugo releases page.
Extract the ZIP file to a folder, e.g., C:\Hugo\bin.
Add the Hugo executable to your PATH:
Right-click on ‘This PC’ and go to ‘Properties’. Click on ‘Advanced system settings’. Click on ‘Environment Variables’. Under ‘System variables’, find the ‘Path’ variable, select it and click ‘Edit’. Click ‘New’ and add the path to your Hugo executable (e.g., C:\Hugo\bin). Click ‘OK’ to save your changes. Open a new command prompt and run hugo version to verify the installation.
macOS#Install Homebrew if you haven’t already: /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" Run brew install hugo Verify the installation by running hugo version Linux#For most Linux distributions, you can install Hugo using your package manager. For example:
Ubuntu or Debian: sudo apt-get install hugo Fedora, Red Hat, or CentOS: sudo dnf install hugo After installation, verify by running hugo version.
Now you’re ready to start creating your Hugo site!

title: My First Blog Post
content:
This is my first blog post using Hugo. Hugo is a fast and flexible static site generator built in Go.
Why Hugo?#Speed: Hugo is one of the fastest static site generators available. Flexibility: It supports a wide range of content types and output formats. Easy to use: With its simple structure and Markdown support, creating content is a breeze. Stay tuned for more posts about my journey with Hugo!
